alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Morgan County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 3:06PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Arapahoe, southwestern Morgan and eastern Adams Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 305 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northeast of Leader, or 23 miles southwest of Fort Morgan, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hoyt, Shamrock, Leader and Adena. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Morgan County
